alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 10:39AM EDT until May 10 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Pennsylvania...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in east central Pennsylvania...Berks, Lehigh, and Northampton. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks, Chester, and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1039 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Allentown, Reading, Easton, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Northampton, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, and Souderton. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 30 and 74. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 11. Northeast Extension between mile markers 32 and 69. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
